intro: Prenanthes erucifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf water hemp, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist environments such as wet meadows and stream banks. Prenanthes erucifolia is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley.
